channel.title: Should I buy it?
channel.description:
inb4 why not build your own pc: I don't know, I prefer pre-built ones.
Well, I'm buying a new computer and I've found one which is pre-built. It's £369.99 and since my uncle is the manager of that store, we can get a 20% discount.
[code] Great performance from the cutting edge Core i3-2120 HD processor. This system comes complete with Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium.
Comes complete with Microsoft Office 2013 trial. CPU and Memory:
Intel Core i3 dual core Intel Core i3-2120. Processor speed 3.3GHz. 8GB DDR3 RAM. Hard drive:
500GB SATA hard drive. DVD optical drives:
Dual layer. Graphics:
Dedicated graphics. NVIDIA GeForce with 1000MB memory. Interfaces and connectivity:
6 USB ports. Ethernet port. Wired keyboard and mouse. Operating system & software:
Microsoft Windows 7 Premium. General features:
Size H36.5, D56.3cm. Weight 8.7kg.[/code]
Tell me if it's good or not and why :D Thanks guys.

item.title: Should I buy it?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

If you are just using this for simple tasks you are getting to much.
Really for just surfing around you have enough with a 250$ build

Read full topic

item.title: Should I buy it?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:19, topic:525733”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=644474.msg4337560#msg4337560 date=1374617009]

I built my gaming pc mainly from amazon with a couple of bits from both ebuyer and overclockers, just go with where ever is cheapest, amazon and ebuyer tend to offer free delivery too.

It’s a lot more expensive for components in the UK for you US guys, you can’t build shit for £350, I’d say he’s getting good value for money. Though a little specificity on that ‘dedicated graphics card’ wouldn’t go amiss…

yeah you can. This guy isn’t telling us the gfx card so it could be like a gt610 who knows
or maybe 210 which is about 20-50$ idk OP Should be specific hint hint
i3s cost around 90 usd or 100 something usd
even prebuilt ones go for cheap these days for example

amazon.com

Amazon.com: CyberpowerPC Gamer Ultra GUA880 Gaming Desktop - AMD FX-4300 Quad Core 3.8GHz, 8GB DDR3 RAM, 1TB HDD, 24X DVD, NVIDIA GT 720 1GB, Windows 7 Pro (Discontinued by Manufacturer): Computers & Accessories

Shop the Windows Store for the full selection of Windows 8 PCs


its not spectacular but for a prebuilt you get what you paid for
[/quote]
Notice I said in the UK…

The cheapest I could find the CPU alone in the UK is £90, £90 is certainly not equal to $90 USD.
Then there’s motherboard, RAM, HDD(s), case, PSU, GPU, good luck keeping that under 350.[/quote]
Ur right… pounds is more than USD.
that computer is about
£347

amazon.co.uk

OCHW AMD BULLDOZER QUAD CORE 3.9Ghz ATI HD 5450 1TB 8GB DDR3 RAM GAMING COMPUTER PC: Amazon.co.uk: Computers & Accessories

Processor Brand: AMD Processor Type: AMD BULLDOZER Processor Speed: 3.9 GHz Processor Socket: SocketAM3 Processor Count: 4 Memory RAM Size: 8000 MB Computer Memory Type: DDR3 SDRAM Hard Drive Hard Dri ...

£334.95


amazon.co.uk

OCHW Home, Office, Gaming PC COMPUTER, Multimedia, Desktop, HOME, PC, Computer, 4.1GHz AMD FX-6300 SIX CORE Piledriver CPU, 2GB ATI RADEON HD R7 240 Graphics Card HDMI DVI, VGA, 1TB HDD Hard Drive, 8GB DDR3 RAM, USB 3.0, WIFI No Operating Software: Amazon.co.uk: Computers & Accessories

OCHW Home, Office, Gaming PC COMPUTER, Multimedia, Desktop, HOME, PC, Computer, 4.1GHz AMD FX-6300 SIX CORE Piledriver CPU, 2GB Nvidia Geforce HD GT 730 Graphics Card HDMI DVI, VGA, 1TB HDD Hard Drive ...


im not sure if amazon.com ships to uk
so i specifically went to UK.
IDK what ur talking about. I could easily get a 660 build for under 550$ or about 360£ easily (iknowforafact in US)
Tho since Im not UK idk what its like
but as you see there amazon uk
It’s prebuilt if it build your own I would imagine 60 pounds less

Read full topic

item.title: Should I buy it?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:16, topic:525733”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=644474.msg4337466#msg4337466 date=1374611092]
I built my gaming pc mainly from amazon with a couple of bits from both ebuyer and overclockers, just go with where ever is cheapest, amazon and ebuyer tend to offer free delivery too.

It’s a lot more expensive for components in the UK for you US guys, you can’t build shit for £350, I’d say he’s getting good value for money. Though a little specificity on that ‘dedicated graphics card’ wouldn’t go amiss…
[/quote]
yeah you can. This guy isn’t telling us the gfx card so it could be like a gt610 who knows
or maybe 210 which is about 20-50$ idk OP Should be specific hint hint
i3s cost around 90 usd or 100 something usd
even prebuilt ones go for cheap these days for example

amazon.com

Amazon.com: CyberpowerPC Gamer Ultra GUA880 Gaming Desktop - AMD FX-4300 Quad Core 3.8GHz, 8GB DDR3 RAM, 1TB HDD, 24X DVD, NVIDIA GT 720 1GB, Windows 7 Pro (Discontinued by Manufacturer): Computers & Accessories

Shop the Windows Store for the full selection of Windows 8 PCs


its not spectacular but for a prebuilt you get what you paid for[/quote]
Notice I said in the UK…

The cheapest I could find the CPU alone in the UK is £90, £90 is certainly not equal to $90 USD.
Then there’s motherboard, RAM, HDD(s), case, PSU, GPU, good luck keeping that under 350.

item.title: Should I buy it?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

^^ what’s wrong with i3
It’s a great processor. I think i3s have hyper threading which allows windows read it as a quad core
I’m not sure too lazy to look it up. (Busy with studying in the summer, finding scholarships)
I understand its dedicated graphics but “nividia GeForce” isn’t specific. Judging by the processor, I’m guessing its a desktop.
What is the hdd speed? What is the ram speed? <---- doesn’t matter too much but I want to know

Read full topic

item.title: Should I buy it?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:1, topic:525733”]inb4 why not build your own pc: I don’t know, I prefer pre-built ones.

Well, I’m buying a new computer and I’ve found one which is pre-built. It’s £369.99 and since my uncle is the manager of that store, we can get a 20% discount.

[code]
Great performance from the cutting edge Core i3-2120 HD processor. This system comes complete with Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium.

Comes complete with Microsoft Office 2013 trial.
CPU and Memory:

Intel Core i3 dual core Intel Core i3-2120.
Processor speed 3.3GHz.
8GB DDR3 RAM.
Hard drive:

500GB SATA hard drive.
DVD optical drives:

Dual layer.
Graphics:

Dedicated graphics.
NVIDIA GeForce with 1000MB memory.
Interfaces and connectivity:

6 USB ports.
Ethernet port.
Wired keyboard and mouse.
Operating system & software:

Microsoft Windows 7 Premium.
General features:

Size H36.5, D56.3cm.
Weight 8.7kg.[/code]

Tell me if it’s good or not and why Thanks guys.[/quote]
It depends what purpose this computer will have.

Read full topic
